title: Part (a)
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response. Students must show their work in order to receive each point.
descriptions:
The response does not calculate the unemployment rate as 10% and/or does not show appropriate work.

Labor Force=Employed+Unemployed =Employed+[Cyclically Unemployed+Frictionally Unemployed+Structurally Unemployed] =63,000+[4,000+1,000+2,000] =63,000+7,000 =70,000 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@C5EE@

Unemployment Rate= Unemployed Labor Force ×100= 7,000 70,000 ×100=10% MathType@MTEF@5@5@@7365@

The response calculates the unemployment rate as 10% and shows appropriate work. Labor Force=Employed+Unemployed =Employed+[Cyclically Unemployed+Frictionally Unemployed+Structurally Unemployed] =63,000+[4,000+1,000+2,000] =63,000+7,000 =70,000 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@C5EE@

Unemployment Rate= Unemployed Labor Force ×100= 7,000 70,000 ×100=10% MathType@MTEF@5@5@@7365@

title: Part (b)
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.

Students must show their work in order to receive each point.
descriptions:
The response does not calculate the labor force participation rate as 70% and/or does not show appropriate work.

Labor force participation rate= Labor Force Population ×100= 70,000 100,000 ×100=70% MathType@MTEF@5@5@@7EB4@

The response calculates the labor force participation rate as 70% and shows appropriate work.

Labor force participation rate= Labor Force Population ×100= 70,000 100,000 ×100=70% MathType@MTEF@5@5@@7EB4@

title: Part (c)
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
The response does not state “no” and/or does not explain that when there is cyclical unemployment, resources are not fully employed and the economy produces below its potential.

OR

The response does not explain that the actual rate of unemployment is greater than the natural rate of unemployment

The response states “no” and explains that when there is cyclical unemployment, resources are not fully employed and the economy produces below its potential.

OR

The response explains that the actual rate of unemployment is greater than the natural rate of unemployment.

title: Part (d)
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.

The two criteria in part (d) are NOT achieved independently.
descriptions: The response does not accurately include any of the criteria below.
The response accurately includes the first criterion below, but not the second.
The response accurately includes both criteria below.
